TopicTitle: Question: Anyone ever made a purely RCS VTOL 'Stock' Kerbin Buggy?

Articles.Content:
Cause I have!!! Proof? Look in the attachments :D

EDIT: The cart from the Cart mod is actually what this is mounted on. Sorry for the trouble, but it slipped my mind as it doesnt affect the function of the buggy
Meh, try without RCS, thats WAY cooler!

Edit: Just redownloaded it and still no wheels. Am I missing something?

Then it\'s not stock.

Cool? Yes. Great minimalist design? Yes. Stock? Not so much.

This is NOT stock, because it uses a plugin. Rename the post, and list the plugins required in the OP.

Just looked in my download for 0.15 and there are no wheels. ???

Edit: Just redownloaded it and still no wheels. Am I missing something?

0_0

look in the utility and scientific for the wheels.

But not the wheels in the OP.
you mean the landing gear? The wheels showing on this craft are not the same, even a cursory look will show that.

you mean the landing gear? The wheels showing on this craft are not the same, even a cursory look will show that.

No, thats a mod.

Okay guys, I edited the post because a detail slipped my mind. But I will post the ship as an attachment so you can have some fun with it too. KEEP IN MIND. It is truly RCS, and RCS boosters aren\'t powerful at all, so they can\'t lift a lot of weight on Kerbin. Less weight capacity means less RCS fuel, so you wont have much fuel to work with. This was really meant as something for possibly the Mun or Minmus, as the gravity there is much weaker and there is no drag. The \'K\' key is to ascend (turn the RCS and the SAS on), while H is to accelerate and N is to decelerate. Normal pitch and yaw controls work as well. Enjoy =P
